(With inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Babar Azam is set to lead Pakistan once again in a five-match Twenty20 series against New Zealand, commencing on Thursday. The series takes place just weeks before the World Cup , with New Zealand fielding a team missing several key players.Last month, Azam's reinstatement as captain came as a surprise, ending Shaheen Shah Afridi's brief tenure and raising concerns about potential discord within the team.However, the team's head coach, Azhar Mahmood , expressed confidence in the selected squad and their high morale, believing they will overcome any shortcomings in preparation for the World Cup in June, to be held in the United States and West Indies."You cannot take any team lightly in the T20 format and if New Zealand is missing their key players then there is an opportunity for their young players," Mahmood told AFP.Pakistan experienced significant changes following their early exit from the one-day World Cup last year, with Azam stepping down as captain across all formats and the departure of head coach Mickey Arthur and PCB chairman Zaka Ashraf.Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi assumed the top position at the board, restructuring the selection committee and facilitating Azam's return. The series also marks the international comeback of fast bowler Mohammad Amir and all-rounder Imad Wasim, who had previously retired.New Zealand, having sent a security team last month, arrived in Pakistan over the weekend. The Black Caps had abruptly canceled a tour in 2021 due to security concerns but returned twice in 2023.The visiting team is without nine top players, including captain Kane Williamson, who are participating in the Indian Premier League. Stand-in skipper Michael Bracewell views this as an opportunity for the younger players to showcase their skills and fresh ideas.However, the team will be without the experienced Tim Southee, the leading wicket-taker in T20 internationals, who has been rested, as well as the injured duo of Adam Milne and Finn Allen. The series will feature three uncapped players in T20s: all-rounder Zac Foulkes, batsman Tim Robinson, and seamer Will O'Rourke.The first three matches of the series will take place in Rawalpindi, with the remaining two to be held in Lahore.Babar Azam (captain), Abrar Ahmed, Azam Khan, Fakhar Zaman, Iftikhar Ahmed, Imad Wasim, Abbas Afridi, Mohammad Rizwan, Mohmmad Amir, Irfan Niazi, Naseem Shah, Saim Ayub, Shadab Khan, Shaheen Shah Afridi, Usama Mir, Usman Khan, Zaman KhanMichael Bracewell (captain), Mark Chapman, Josh Clarkson, Jacob Duffy, Dean Foxcroft, Ben Lister, Cole McConchie, Jimmy Neesham, Will O'Rourke, Tim Robinson, Ben Sears, Tim Seifert, Ish Sodhi, Zac Foulkes, Tom Blundell
Article Summary: Pakistan face New Zealand in a five-match Twenty20 series starting on Thursday. The series takes place just weeks before the World Cup in June. New Zealand will be without several key players, including captain Kane Williamson. The first three matches of the series will take place in Rawalpindi, with the remaining two to be held in Lahore.

Article Title: Hardik Pandya: Hardik Pandya's inclusion in T20 World Cup squad depends on IPL bowling performance: Report
Article Text: NEW DELHI: India captain Rohit Sharma recently held a meeting with head coach Rahul Dravid and chief selector Ajit Agarkar in Mumbai during the ongoing IPL 2024 season, according to a media report. The primary agenda of the meeting, which took place at the BCCI headquarters, was to discuss the squad composition for the upcoming T20 World Cup .According to a report by The Indian Express, a crucial decision was made regarding Hardik Pandya 's inclusion in the team.The trio decided that bowling regularly during the IPL 2024 will be key to Pandya's chances of making the cut in the squad.IPL 2024: POINTS TABLE The meeting focused significantly on the selection of fast bowling all-rounders for the T20 World Cup, which will be co-hosted by the USA and Caribbean islands in June. However, the selectors face a challenge due to the limited quality options available.Despite this, they are closely monitoring Shivam Dube, who has been impressive with the bat but has only been utilized as an Impact Player by his franchise, Chennai Super Kings , due to their abundant bowling resources.Hardik Pandya, who is also leading the Mumbai Indians this season, has been struggling with his bowling form. In six games, he has bowled 11 overs, taking three wickets but conceding runs at an alarming economy rate of 12 per over.The Indian team management hopes that Pandya can find his rhythm, as his seam bowling adds balance to the playing XI, and his powerful hitting provides depth to the batting lineup.Reports suggest that the Indian selection committee is set to meet later this month to finalize the squad for the T20 World Cup, with the performance of the hopefuls in the ongoing IPL expected to play a significant role in their decision-making process.
Article Summary: India captain Rohit Sharma recently held a meeting with head coach Rahul Dravid and chief selector Ajit Agarkar in Mumbai. The primary agenda of the meeting was to discuss the squad composition for the upcoming T20 World Cup. A crucial decision was made regarding Hardik Pandya's inclusion in the team.

Article Title: Former West Germany World Cup winner Bernd Hoelzenbein passes away at 78
Article Text:
(With inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Bernd Hoelzenbein , a member of the victorious West Germany team at the 1974 World Cup , passed away at the age of 78, as announced by his long-time club Eintracht Frankfurt on Tuesday.Throughout his career, Hoelzenbein scored five goals in 40 appearances for West Germany, playing as both a striker and a winger.In the 1974 World Cup final against the Netherlands in Munich, he won a crucial penalty that was converted by Paul Breitner , equalizing the score at 1-1.Despite facing criticism from Dutch fans for allegedly diving, Hoelzenbein maintained throughout his life that it was a "clear penalty."Gerd Mueller 's decisive goal late in the first half secured a 2-1 victory for Germany and their second World Cup title.Hoelzenbein also made an impact in the 1976 European Championship final, scoring a late goal to level the match at 2-2 against Czechoslovakia. However, Germany ultimately lost the match on penalties.At the club level, Hoelzenbein spent the majority of his career with Eintracht Frankfurt, where he remains the club's all-time top scorer with 160 goals in 420 appearances. During his 14-year tenure with Frankfurt, he won three German Cups and the UEFA Cup.After leaving the Eagles, Hoelzenbein played for several years in the United States with the Fort Lauderdale Strikers, Memphis Americans, and the Baltimore Blast.Upon returning to Frankfurt, Hoelzenbein worked with the club as an administrator and scout.Eintracht Frankfurt CEO Axel Hellmann expressed the club's sense of loss, stating, "Bernd Hoelzenbein has had a significant influence on Eintracht Frankfurt for almost 60 years. We are not only losing one of the great identification figures of our club, but also a loyal employee and a lovely friend."
Article Summary: Bernd Hoelzenbein, a member of the victorious West Germany team at the 1974 World Cup, has passed away at the age of 78. He scored five goals in 40 appearances for West Germany, playing as both a striker and a winger. He spent the majority of his career with Eintracht Frankfurt, where he remains the club's all-time top scorer.

Article Title: Mohun Bagan pip Mumbai City to win maiden League Shield
Article Text: KOLKATA: As referee Venkatesh R blew the final whistle, the entire Mohun Bagan SG bench huddled around Antonio Lopez Habas , hugging and exchanging high fives with him. In the middle of the Salt Lake Stadium , Manvir Singh, Liston Colaco , Dimitri Petratos and others began dancing and jumping in joy.It was party time for Mohun Bagan, the new winners of the Indian Super League ’s coveted Shield.It was their tryst with history. They won the championship last season but their trophy cabinet was missing the ISL Shield — still considered the real big prize after the end of a home-and-away league.It was quite a statement of intent made by Habas’ team in achieving that goal as they pipped Mumbai City FC to the post with a 2-1 win, thus topping ISL 2023-2024 group stage as winners and conquering the throne of Indian domestic football in style.Goals from Liston Colaco (20th minute) and second half substitute Jason Cummings (80) set the green-and-maroon brigade to a comfortable lead. Although Lallianzuala Chhangte reduced the margin in the stoppage time (90+2), it was not enough for Petr Kratky’s visitors, who needed at least a draw to defend the Shield.Mohun Bagan finished the league this term with 48 points from 22 matches, a point ahead of Mumbai City and with a place guaranteed in the AFC Champions League 2.It was a tale of many firsts for Mohun Bagan. Their maiden Shield-winning triumph since the award was introduced in the 2019-2020 season came on the back of their first win against Mumbai City in nine meetings.
Article Summary: Mohun Bagan beat Mumbai City FC 2-1 to win the ISL Shield. Liston Colaco and Jason Cummings scored the goals for the home side. Lallianzuala Chhangte equalised for the visitors in stoppage time.

Article Title: Chelsea's Cole Palmer hits second successive hat-trick at Stamford Bridge
Article Text:
(With Reuters inputs)

Chelsea midfielder Cole Palmer showcased his exceptional goal-scoring prowess by netting a remarkable hat-trick within the first 30 minutes of his team's Premier League clash against Everton on Monday, securing his second successive treble at Stamford Bridge .Palmer's scoring spree began in the 13th minute when he skillfully maneuvered past Everton's Jared Branthwaite, executed a swift one-two with Nicolas Jackson , and calmly slotted the ball past goalkeeper Jordan Pickford from the edge of the box.Just five minutes later, Palmer capitalized on some hesitant Everton defending as Pickford parried a shot from Jackson into his path, allowing Palmer to tap it into the empty net for his second goal of the match.The talented midfielder completed his hat-trick in style in the 29th minute, intercepting Pickford's clearance 30 meters out and deftly chipping the ball over the goalkeeper with his weaker foot.This impressive performance marked Palmer's second consecutive hat-trick at Stamford Bridge, following his heroics in a thrilling 4-3 victory over Manchester United on April 4. With this feat, Palmer's goal tally for the season soared to 22, making him the first Chelsea player since Eden Hazard in 2018/19 to reach the 20-goal mark.To add to Chelsea's dominance, Jackson also found the back of the net just before half-time, further extending their lead to 4-0 in what proved to be an outstanding display of attacking football from the home side.
Article Summary: Cole Palmer scored a hat-trick in Chelsea's 4-0 win over Everton. It was his second successive treble at Stamford Bridge. His goal tally for the season now stands at 22. He is the first Chelsea player since Eden Hazard to reach the 20-goal mark.

Article Title: Mohun Bagan stand in way of history-chasing Mumbai
Article Text:
Kratky's side needs just a draw to become first team to win ISL shield in successive seasons

KOLKATA: In the end, it has come down to the wire.It's a final with a difference. No extra-time, no penalty shootout, but plenty at stake - pride, prestige… and, of course the big prize.As Mohun Bagan SG prepare to host Mumbai City in the concluding fixture of the Indian Super League at the Salt Lake Stadium on Monday, the chase for the coveted League Winners' Shield will predictably take centre stage.The equation is simple, though.Petr Kratky 's Mumbai City, with 47 points from 21 matches, need just a draw to become the first team to win the Shield in successive seasons and for the third time overall since the award was introduced in the 2019-2020 season.Mohun Bagan, lying 2 points behind, need to make history to change the script. They might be the defending champions but the green-and-maroon brigade is yet to lay its hands on the Shield - finishing first in the home-and-away league is what many consider the real big prize. Moreover, in their 8 ISL meetings in the past since the century-old Kolkata club's entry into the league, Mohun Bagan are yet to get the better of the rivals from Mumbai."Mumbai are two points ahead of us and favourite to win the league. But in front of 60000 home fans, we will be ready to give them a good fight," Bagan's assistant coach Manuel Perez, addressing the pre-match press conference in absence of Antonio Lopez Habas , said on Sunday.The veteran Habas, who has been indisposed for over a fortnight, supervised the team's training session on the match-eve and is expected to lead his team from the dug-out looking to conquer the final frontier."It is always a privilege to be high up on the ladder, and it is an exciting time for us," Kratky said before arriving here, revealing that his team will miss forward Vikram Partap Singh through suspension.According to him, staying mentally strong is the key to surviving the pressure of a packed partisan crowd. Yet, the onus is more on Bagan to seize the moment.The team has undergone quite a transformation since Habas' return and the arrival of influential and injury-free Joni Kauko . The Finland international is urging his teammates to embrace the challenge with a patient and an uncluttered mind."You can't expect to get a goal right in the beginning tomorrow. We need to be patient, need to be calm in our approach (to the game). And we need to play our own game, that's the key," the Bagan midfielder said.Barring the absence of injured Sahal Abdul Samad, Bagan have everyone available for selection. From Odisha FC to FC Goa to Kerala Blasters, many teams have come to lead the table in these past few months. But Bagan and Mumbai have proved why their rivalry has assumed new dimensions.
Article Summary: Mohun Bagan SG host Mumbai City in the final of the Indian Super League on Monday. Mumbai City need just a draw to become the first team to win the Shield in successive seasons and for the third time overall since the award was introduced in the 2019-2020 season.

Article Title: Leon Bailey and Ollie Watkins dent Arsenal's title hopes in Premier League loss to Aston Villa
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Arsenal 's Premier League title aspirations took a hit as late goals from Aston Villa 's Leon Bailey and Ollie Watkins sealed a surprising 2-0 defeat for the Gunners at home. Manager Mikel Arteta , while disappointed, remains steadfast, urging his team to rise to the challenge."We knew that this moment could come and now it's about reacting and keep believing and doing what we can," Arteta affirmed.Despite their first league loss in 12 games, Arsenal stay in second place, just two points adrift of leaders Manchester City . With six gamesremaining, Arteta stressed the importance of resilience and belief in their pursuit.Looking ahead to their Champions League clash with Bayern Munich, Arteta sees it as "a beautiful opportunity" for redemption after a midweek draw.Meanwhile, Villa's impressive win boosts their bid for a Champions League spot, moving them three points clear of Tottenham Hotspur. Ollie Watkins, the hero of the match, emphasized the significance of their performance."It's massive to come away to Arsenal when they are playing such goodfootball and to play like that just shows where we are going really, it was a perfect away performance," Watkins praised.Villa manager Unai Emery acknowledged his team's emergence as contenders for the top four, recognizing the significance of their victory over Arsenal."We prepared this match really as a very difficult match, but a great opportunity to try to get three points," Emery stated, acknowledging the significance of their push for European qualification.While the road ahead may be challenging, both Arsenal and Villa are determined to maintain their momentum as the Premier League season reaches its climax.
Article Summary: Aston Villa beat Arsenal 2-0 in the Premier League. Leon Bailey and Ollie Watkins scored the goals for Villa. Arsenal remain in second place, two points adrift of leaders Manchester City. Manager Mikel Arteta urges his team to rise to the challenge.

Article Title: Serie A round-up: Inter's title hopes hang on Milan derby; Roma's Evan Ndicka recovers after collapse
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Inter Milan faced a setback in their quest for the Serie A title after a tense 2-2 draw against Cagliari, while Roma encountered a scare as defender Evan Ndicka collapsed during their match against Udinese.Inter's dream of securing the Serie A crown in the Milan derby was put on hold as they failed to capitalize on a home advantage, settling for a draw against relegation-threatened Cagliari.Despite Hakan Calhanoglu's late penalty securing a lead, Nicolas Viola's strike dashed Inter's hopes of extending their lead at the top of the league.Manager Simone Inzaghi expressed frustration at missing out on a win crucial for their title ambitions but remains confident ahead of the upcoming derby clash, where Inter will aim to seal their 20th league crown.Meanwhile, AC Milan 's hopes of challenging Inter were dampened after a thrilling 3-3 draw against Sassuolo, leaving them with a mountain to climb in the title race.In another dramatic turn, Roma's Evan Ndicka collapsed during their game against Udinese, leading the match to be abandoned. Fortunately, the defender is reported to be recovering well, providing a sigh of relief for the club and fans alike.With Serie A's top spots still up for grabs, the race for Champions League qualification intensifies, with Roma maintaining their position in fifth despite the disruption. Napoli's aspirations took a hit following a draw against struggling Frosinone, further complicating their bid for a top-five finish.
Article Summary: Inter Milan held to a 2-2 draw by Cagliari in Serie A. AC Milan's hopes of challenging Inter were dampened by a 3-3 draw against Sassuolo. Roma's Evan Ndicka collapsed during their game against Udinese.

Article Title: Bayer Leverkusen secure maiden Bundesliga title with 5-0 win over Werder Bremen
Article Text:
(With Reuters inputs)

Undefeated Bayer Leverkusen clinched their first Bundesliga title in style on Sunday, demolishing Werder Bremen 5-0 and ending Bayern Munich 's 11-year reign atop the league.Under the guidance of Xabi Alonso , Leverkusen achieved a remarkable feat, extending their unbeaten streak to a league-record 29 matches this season. This triumph marks their first Bundesliga trophy since 1993, boasting a commanding 16-point lead over Bayern with five matches remaining.The victory solidifies Leverkusen's dominance, with the team eyeing further success in the German Cup final and the Europa League quarter-finals, where they hold a 2-0 advantage over West Ham United.Leverkusen's title-clinching performance was highlighted by Florian Wirtz 's hat-trick, sealing their triumph at the earliest opportunity and extending their unbeaten run across all competitions to an impressive 43 games this season."I cannot describe this," Germany international Wirtz said. "I personally can still not realise this has happened. I will need a few moments in the changing room to understand what we have achieved."We could not have imagined something like this when you see how the previous season went."Leverkusen earned a crucial penalty in the 24th minute, and Victor Boniface , returning from a three-month injury layoff, confidently converted to notch his first league goal since December and his 11th of the season.The hosts dominated the first half, creating numerous opportunities to extend their lead, with Amine Adli even striking the woodwork.Excitement filled the air as fans, who had eagerly gathered since early morning, eagerly anticipated their team's imminent triumph, eagerly awaiting the moment they could witness history.After the break, Bremen sought to disrupt Leverkusen's celebrations, but Granit Xhaka 's sensational strike from 25 meters out in the 60th minute ignited jubilant scenes among the home supporters.Leverkusen's relentless attack continued, with substitute Florian Wirtz adding another goal in the 68th minute. Wirtz, gearing up for Euro 2024, further bolstered his credentials with two more goals in the 83rd and 90th minutes, completing his hat-trick and sealing Leverkusen's title victory in emphatic fashion.As thousands of jubilant Leverkusen supporters stormed the pitch to celebrate their first trophy in 31 years, the stadium erupted in euphoria, marking a historic moment for the club and its loyal fans."The team under coach Xabi Alonso played thrilling and champion-worthy football," German FA President Bernd Neuendorf said."They have not yet lost a game and left no doubt whatsoever about who would be at the top in the end."
Article Summary: Bayer Leverkusen beat Werder Bremen 5-0 to clinch their first Bundesliga title since 1993. Victory ends Bayern Munich's 11-year reign atop the league. Florian Wirtz scored a hat-trick, extending his unbeaten run to 43 games this season.

Article Title: Liverpool's title challenge in tatters after Crystal Palace defeat
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Liverpool 's hopes for a Premier League title took a significant hit as Crystal Palace secured a 1-0 victory at Anfield on Sunday.This defeat marks Liverpool's first home loss in 29 league games, leaving Jurgen Klopp 's squad two points behind Manchester City and on par with Arsenal. Arsenal has the opportunity to claim the top spot with a win over Aston Villa later on Sunday.Eberechi Eze's early goal secured a crucial win for the Eagles in their fight for survival, pushing them eight points clear of the relegation zone.Yet, Liverpool's last season under Klopp appears to be unraveling.Just a few weeks ago, the League Cup champions were on track to achieve a quadruple.But after crashing out of the FA Cup to Manchester United, Liverpool succumbed to a first home defeat in any competition for 14 months when Atalanta stormed Anfield on Thursday to take a 3-0 first leg lead in their Europa League quarter-final tie.Klopp's men have now won just three of their last eight games in all competitions and are showing clear signs of fatigue after already having played 51 games this season.Slow starts have been a recurring theme of Liverpool's struggles of late and they were again forced to come from behind.Alisson Becker made his long-awaited return in goal for the home side but he had no chance when Eze was left with a simple finish from Tyrick Mitchell's cross.Palace were millimetres away from a second moments later when Andy Robertson produced a remarkable goalline clearance to deny Jean-Philippe Mateta after Virgil van Dijk's slip let the French striker through.Liverpool had to resort to set-pieces to put the Palace defence under pressure in the first half.Wataru Endo's scuffed effort came back off the crossbar.Dean Henderson then produced a stunning save to prevent Luis Diaz levelling at the back post with an acrobatic effort.Klopp reacted at half-time with the introduction of Dominik Szoboszlai and Trent Alexander-Arnold's return after two months out quickly followed when Conor Bradley went down injured.Diogo Jota and Cody Gakpo were also sent on for the rescue mission from the bench.Jota looked certain to equalise when picked out by Szoboszlai but the Portuguese forward's finish hit Nathaniel Clyne on the line with the goal gaping.At the other end, Alisson showed why he is one of the world's best goalkeepers with a remarkable stop to turn Mateta's strike over from point-blank range.Liverpool galloped immediately up the other end and Curtis Jones slotted wide with just Henderson to beat.Mohamed Salah had one final chance to at least snatch a point, but his goalbound effort was brilliantly blocked by Mitchell in stoppage time.Unless Liverpool produce a stunning fightback against Atalanta in midweek, Klopp will have just two more games at Anfield before his momentous reign comes to an end.But what looked like it could be a glorious goodbye is now at danger of turning into a damp squib.
Article Summary: Eberechi Eze's early goal secured a crucial win for the Eagles in their fight for survival. This defeat marks Liverpool's first home loss in 29 league games. Arsenal has the opportunity to claim the top spot with a win over Aston Villa later on Sunday.

Article Title: Lionel Messi scores as record crowd witnesses Inter Miami's victory over Sporting Kansas City
Article Text:
(With inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: A staggering 72,610 fans packed Arrowhead Stadium to witness Inter Miami 's thrilling 3-2 victory over Sporting Kansas City . The match, which saw Lionel Messi shine, marked a significant milestone for the city's soccer scene.Lionel Messi, the main attraction behind the relocation of the match from Sporting's usual home stadium to Arrowhead, played a pivotal role in Miami's triumph.The global football icon showcased his brilliance with a goal and an assist, captivating the massive crowd with his performance.Miami took a 2-1 lead in the 51st minute when Messi unleashed a powerful strike from long range, finding the upper-right corner of the SKC net. However, Sporting quickly responded as Erik Thommy netted his second goal of the night in the 58th minute, leveling the score.The decisive moment arrived in the 71st minute when a mistake by Sporting KC allowed Miami's Diego Gomez to set up Luis Suarez for the winning goal, securing the victory for the visitors.Sporting had opened the scoring in the sixth minute through Thommy's clinical finish, but Miami swiftly equalized in the 18th minute courtesy of a well-taken goal by Gomez, set up by Messi.The match showcased moments of brilliance from both sides, with Messi coming close to adding to his tally with a threatening free-kick in the 41st minute. Sporting also had their chances, with Willy Agada testing Miami's goalkeeper Drake Callender.The record-breaking crowd at Arrowhead Stadium surpassed the previous attendance record set in 2010 when the then-Kansas City Wizards faced Manchester United in an exhibition match.
Article Summary: A staggering 72,610 fans packed Arrowhead Stadium to witness Inter Miami's thrilling 3-2 victory over Sporting Kansas City. The match, which saw Lionel Messi shine, marked a significant milestone for the city's soccer scene. Messi, the main attraction behind the relocation of the match from Sporting's usual home stadium to Arrowhead, played a pivotal role in Miami's triumph.

Article Title: La Liga round-up: Real Madrid clinch hard-fought win against Mallorca; Atletico Madrid thump Girona
Article Text:
(Inputs from AP)

NEW DELHI: Real Madrid clinched a hard-fought 1-0 win against Mallorca in the Spanish league on Saturday, resting key players ahead of their crucial Champions League game against Manchester City . Midfielder Aurélien Tchouaméni 's strike three minutes into the second half proved decisive, maintaining Madrid's commanding lead in the league.The victory on the Mediterranean island extended Madrid's lead in the league to 11 points, setting the stage for a crucial clash with Manchester City on Wednesday.Tchouaméni, who will miss the game in England due to suspension, emphasized Madrid's determination despite fatigue from their previous encounter with City."We have a very important game Wednesday," said Tchouaméni. "We played a very difficult game against City and we are tired, but we know that when we play for Madrid we have to give it our all until the end."Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti made strategic substitutions in the second half, with Vinicius Júnior and Eduardo Camavinga making crucial contributions. Dani Carvajal also joined the action in the final minutes, while key players like Rodrygo and Toni Kroos remained on the bench.Tchouaméni's long-range strike, which deflected off a defender, was the only breakthrough Madrid managed against a resilient Mallorca defense. Despite the victory, Madrid faces a tough test against Manchester City in the Champions League quarterfinal, followed by a pivotal La Liga clash against Barcelona.Ancelotti's milestone 183rd league game coached for Madrid draws him level with Zinedine Zidane, second only to Miguel Muñoz's record 424 league games.In another fixture, Atletico Madrid secured a vital 3-1 victory over Girona, with Antoine Griezmann scoring twice to boost their top-four aspirations. Atletico's victory places them in contention for Champions League qualification, while Girona's fourth-minute lead was short-lived as Atletico staged a remarkable comeback.With crucial Champions League fixtures on the horizon, both Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid will aim to maintain their momentum and secure their spots in European football 's elite competition next season.
Article Summary: Real Madrid beat Mallorca 1-0 to extend lead in Spanish league to 11 points. Aurélien Tchouaméni scored only goal of the game in the second half. Atletico Madrid beat Girona 3-1 to boost top-four aspirations.

Article Title: Social media plea works, Sumit Nagal gets UK visa appointment to play in Wimbledon
Article Text:
(With IANS inputs)

NEW DELHI: India's top tennis player, Sumit Nagal , faced a hurdle in obtaining a UK visa appointment for his participation in Wimbledon 2024. Nagal took to social media platform X (formerly Twitter), to plead with the UK visa authority for assistance after his initial attempts proved unsuccessful.With Wimbledon scheduled from July 1-14 at the prestigious All-England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club in London, Nagal's participation was imperative for representing India on the international stage.In a turn of events, Nagal's plea on social media caught the attention of the UK visa authority, prompting them to swiftly address his request. Responding promptly, they provided Nagal with the required appointment, ensuring that he could proceed with his visa application without further delay.Expressing his gratitude, Nagal acknowledged the UK visa authority's assistance through another post on X, wherein he also deleted the previous one. This development not only highlights the power of social media in connecting individuals with authorities but also underscores the importance of timely intervention in facilitating international sporting events and athletes' participation.“Thank You Christian Scott mam (Deputy High Commissioner of British High Commission in India), British High Commission in India, and VFSGlobal for your swift response on my UK visa appointment request. Really appreciate your help!” Nagal wrote on Twitter.Nagal, 26, achieved a remarkable career-high men's singles ranking of 80 in the latest ATP Rankings , released on Monday, following an impressive showing at theMonte Carlo Masters . Nagal's ascent in the rankings was fueled by his solid performance in the prestigious tournament.Securing a spot in the main draw of the Monte Carlo Masters was a significant achievement for Nagal, achieved after defeating Italy's Flavio Cobolli and Argentina's Facundo Diaz Acosta in the qualifiers.Nagal's presence in the main draw marked him as only the third Indian player to compete at this level on clay, following in the footsteps of Vijay Amritraj (1977) and Ramesh Krishnan (1982).In the opening round of the tournament, Nagal created history by defeating World No. 38 Matteo Arnald of Italy, becoming the first Indian player to win an ATP Masters 1000 match on clay since the series' inception in 1990. This victory underscored Nagal's growing prowess on the international stage.Although Nagal's journey in the Monte Carlo Masters ended in the second round with a loss to seventh seed and 2023 runner-up Holger Rune, his overall performance was commendable.As a result of his stellar showing, Nagal ascended 13 spots in the ATP Rankings, reaching a new career high and further solidifying his status as one of India's top tennis talents.
Article Summary: India's top tennis player, Sumit Nagal, faced a hurdle in obtaining a UK visa appointment for his participation in Wimbledon 2024. Nagal took to social media platform X (formerly Twitter), to plead with the UK visa authority for assistance after his initial attempts proved unsuccessful. In a turn of events, Nagal's plea on social media caught the attention of the British visa authority, prompting them to swiftly address his request.

Article Title: Nadal confirms comeback at Barcelona Open, to face Cobolli
Article Text:
(With Reuters inputs)

NEW DELHI: Rafael Nadal has officially announced his participation in this week's Barcelona Open , marking the Spaniard's return to competitive tennis after a hiatus since January."I arrived here a bit like in a last minute decision as I didn't know if I was going to be able to play," the 22-time Grand Slam champion told a press conference on Monday."Tomorrow I'm going to be on the court."The 37-year-old Nadal, who last competed in an ATP Tour match in Brisbane back in January, opted out of the Monte Carlo Masters last week, citing his body's lack of readiness for competition.The former world number one has expressed his intention to retire following the conclusion of the 2024 season. However, his determination to participate in the French Open remains unwavering, aiming to add to his unparalleled tally of 14 titles at the prestigious tournament.Nadal's appearance in Brisbane was his first match in almost a year in which he was sidelined by a hip flexor injury.He has won the Barcelona title on 12 occasions but has not played in the claycourt event since 2021.His first match will be against 21-year-old Italian Flavio Cobolli on Tuesday.
Article Summary: Rafael Nadal has announced his participation in this week's Barcelona Open. The Spaniard has not played since the Brisbane Open back in January. Nadal opted out of the Monte Carlo Masters last week citing his body's lack of readiness. The 22-time Grand Slam champion has expressed his intention to retire in 2024.

Article Title: Stefanos Tsitsipas dismantles Casper Ruud to secure third Monte Carlo title
Article Text:
(With Reuters inputs)

Stefanos Tsitsipas clinched his third Monte Carlo Masters title in four years with a commanding 6-1, 6-4 victory over Norwegian eighth seed Casper Ruud on Sunday.Tsitsipas displayed dominance from the start, swiftly securing the opening set by winning six consecutive games in just 36 minutes.While the second set saw a tighter contest, Tsitsipas remained formidable, ultimately overpowering Ruud.His straight-sets triumph marked a historic milestone as he became the first player in the professional era to claim three Monte Carlo finals without dropping a set.Tsitsipas, who recently defeated Australian Open champion Jannik Sinner in the semifinals, notched his first title of 2024, elevating his career tally to 11 titles.Tsitsipas joins Rafa Nadal, Bjorn Borg, Thomas Muster and Ilie Nastase to win at least three Monte Carlo titles."It's been very difficult. To be back on the podiums and winning tournaments feels amazing," Tsitsipas said."I can't thank enough my family and friends... for making this possible."The trinity is even more special than the first or second time. This is purely unbelievable for me. Capturing that win today was nerve-wracking. I really wanted the trinity so I got it. I'm extremely happy today."Having come into the claycourt Masters 1000 event with an 11-6 win-loss record for 2024, Tsitsipas will return to the world's top 10 on Monday after dropping out for the first time since 2019 earlier in the year.But it was yet another heartbreak for former French and U.S. Open finalist Ruud, who had stunned world number one Novak Djokovic in the semis, having lost the Mexican and Los Cabos Open final earlier this year."I'd like to congratulate Stef for winning Monte Carlo once again," Ruud said. "You (Tsitsipas) love this tournament. Very, very well played all week."I know you fell out of top 10 a few weeks ago but you're back again where I think you belong. You're a fantastic player and especially on clay and Monte Carlo... Congratulations to you and your team."
Article Summary: Stefanos Tsitsipas wins third Monte Carlo Masters title in four years. Beats Casper Ruud 6-1, 6-4 in Sunday's final. First player in professional era to claim three Monte Carlo finals without dropping a set. Joins Rafa Nadal, Bjorn Borg, Thomas Muster and Ilie Nastase to win at least three titles.

Article Title: Jeevan keen to get back in Slams and make deeper runs
Article Text: PUNE: Arjun Kadhe and Jeevan Nedunchezhiyan claimed their first title together on Saturday by winning the $82K Morelos Open in Cuernavaca, Mexico.The Indian combination defeated second seeds Piotr Matuszewski of Poland and Matthew Christopher Romios of Austria 7-6 (5), 6-4 in the final of the ATP Challenger hard-court tennis event.It is Jeevan's 33rd career title and Arjun's 19th, and will be a big boost for both as they started pairing at the start of the season.Jeevan will move up five places to 127 in the latest rankings and Arjun 13 spots to 102 after their victory."It feels great to win a title, always. It is true I have come close to winning a title in the last couple of years but fell a little short, but it makes this victory that much sweeter," said Jeevan, whose trophy cabinet includes the 2017 ATP Chennai Open silverware won in tandem with current World No. 2 Rohan Bopanna.The title run in Cuernavaca was all the more remarkable considering the third seeds were coming off the US Clay Court championships in Houston last week."Yes, the conditions in Mexico were fast and quick because there is a little bit of altitude in most cities where Challenger events are held. The conditions did help Arjun's and my style, and we definitely took advantage of our opportunities this week," said the 35-year-old southpaw.The Tamil Nadu lad has tasted success with different partners since switching focus to doubles in the mid-2000s, and said having a similar mindset and vision was the key to his partnership with Arjun."What makes it tick with Arjun is that we are both hungry to get better and some good guidance from Raven Klaasen (head coach for the Indian players under the Doubles Dream of India programme) has definitely made us better as a team," he said.Jeevan has had a career-high ranking of 64, which came in March 2019 and marked a key milestone during a phase when he played in all the four Grand Slams -- beginning with the US Open in 2018 and culminating with the Wimbledon in 2019.He, however, agreed he has matured as a player since then."Yes, you could say that I am wiser and more experienced now. I feel that if anything I am more ready now to accept that, 'yes, it was great to play those Grand Slams and be in the big tournaments' but I am trying to have a vision now of not just being in the Grand Slams when I get back there but also make a run in the slams and go deeper in those tournaments," said Jeevan."I know it takes small steps at a time and a Challenger title always sets the tone, a good platform to build a good season on."
Article Summary: Arjun Kadhe and Jeevan Nedunchezhiyan win $82K Morelos Open in Cuernavaca, Mexico. Indian combination defeated second seeds Piotr Matuszewski of Poland and Matthew Christopher Romios of Austria 7-6 (5), 6-4 in the final.
